reviews.review_msg: Shane's teaching style is good. Overhead and power point slides usually can't go wrong. I thought he was too strict. I asked him one of the exam practice questions before the final took place, yet he wouldn't help me or tell me anything about it. It made it fair, but at the same time harder on students. He's funny, got good sense of humour, though.
lots of reading but alos lots of videos..A++++ for the videos....easy to get along with

oh, i wrote the review below and i meant cmns223, not cmns372 ... anyway, i highly recommend that you take a course with kammerer, whether as a TA or instructor, though there were some problems with this course and with the lectures.

Steve is a pretty nice person. He seems to be really interested in the subject, however I felt he didn't have enough background in advertising. He was also sometimes underprepared for his lectures. Eventhough he didn't always had the slides to copy notes from, he explained the concepts pretty clearly. Tip: Attend his tutorials.

Good choice of readings, and thought provoking. Steve was nice and easy to talk to, however at times I felt he was under prepared. Yet all classes I have ever taken with grad students as teachers has been the same. In a way it is both the students and the teacher who is missing out.

Prof Khan is a genuinely nice person. He is also very accommodating and is willing to listen to the opinions of his students. Lectures are interesting and notes are helpful. However, he sometimes goes off topic and talks about India. haha! I highly recommend people to take his classes!
very good prof..very knowledgable..I thought he marked very fairly, I didn't think he marked too hard at all...I enjoyed this class!!!

Lecture and readings are extremely important. Focus on main themes and vocabs each week in his lectures. Readings help you understand his lecture and assignment. He is a friendly and helpful teacher, seek help from him. He's marking is a bit harsh BUT it's changable. Particpate in his extra % writing. Good luck

Nth much to say about this Prof...If anyone of you out there are academic probation and planning to take his class later, you would probably end up required to withdraw from SFU for the next semester..triple consider before taking his class guys and I'm serious about it...
For those of you taking CMNS 223 next semester (Spring 09).  Good Luck with this guy!!
His lectures are most often really interesting, and is open for debate when covering material. Jokes are always present during lectures and is really responsive to students
Anil is hilarious. His lectures are fairly interesting, even though he does have a tendency to stray from the material a bit. He's a super nice guy and really willing to help.
No Comments
Sends lecture slides prior to class, but elaborates some details on it.
No Comments

Holy smokes! This class was HARD!!!!  Like what most of you said, the lects were pretty interesting, but the TAs ruined the course.  They were extremely unhelpful and disrespectful.  If you said anything wrong during tutorial, the TA will point at you and say "YOU ARE WRONG".  Right in front of the whole class!  Good Class... VERY VERY BAD TAs!

Interesting lectures and tonnes of information were given out during lecture so attending class is a must. When it comes to essay, she and her TAs are definitely the hardest marker in the faculty, really bias and if we don't write in the way she or her TAs expected, very very low grade would be received.

Zoe is a truly great professor and she is extremely helpful outside of class. She delivers insightful lectures, complete with extremely relevant media samples. I loved this class. However, going to tutorials was torture and I can always count on the TA to be confusing in both her teachings AND marking. Take this class to learn, but expect poor mark

Even there are a lot of readings, researches and works to do in this course. however, you will benifit out of it, in your future studies, her lectures and reaserch methods are really useful. Zeo and her TA are willing to guild her student through, a very helpful and turstworthy prof and course.

One of the MOST interestingn class in the cmns department!! Prof is awsome, very interesting lecture..must go!! However, her assignemnts were REALLY REALLY hard. I thought the marking scheme was VERY UNFAIR.

She makes each class very interesting, often using videos or picture slides to complement her lecture, yet when it comes time for essay writing and her final exam, the questions were too difficult, and her T.A.s mark too hard.  She gives A LOT of information at each lecture, so make sure you attend!  The book and CCW have complex texts to follow.

Druik, is a great prof.  I actually haven't fallen asleep in the class!  Druik is able to make course concepts relatively easy to understand.  In addition, she is pretty approachable.  Good course, good class!
zoe is great. lectures are never boring. the class was a bit difficult, demanding and the marking was hard.  take the class if ur interested in advertising but not if youre looking for an easy A

I throught Zoe was a great prof.  She's well prepared, organized, considerate and fair. I appreciated the fact that she gave us essay topics well in advance as well as a very clear outline of what to expect for the final.  No midterm for this class, which was nice.  I'd recomment it for sure!
Good prepartation before class. We have 3 essays and 1 final.
loved her, awesome class
She's awesome at making difficult concepts easy (Commodity fetishism!). Totally approachable, and generally fabulous.
No Comments
She's good, makes things interesting. She's a little scatter-brained and sometimes she comes off as just making stuff up.

Her lectures were really really good, and lots of fun. One of the best profs at SFU, although I was kind of mad that I did not end up doing as well as I thought I would. I think it was the TA's fault however.
The course in general is about critiquing ads, so if you're interested in that, take the course. As for Zoe, she is a good lecturer, a bit fast on the talking though.

very knowledgeable and lectures were always interesting and engaging. it's easy to get overwhelmed by everything she gives you, tho, because she's such a brilliant academic and definitely has lots to impart. but she's also quite generous with her exams...
This Prof is engaging.. Interesting and very into her work as a academic... also one of the best looking profs I can say in all of communications... haha.. go Zoe!
No Comments
Great lecturer with lots of interesting examples which demonstrates his passion for the course concepts. Off topic, but he's like a Stanley Tucci + Steve Carell hybrid.

Jody is very good teacher and so is  the TA!! His instructions about about to do are very clear and the lecture slides are easy to understand. Although the course requires a lot of readings and writings, it provides insights into thinking. Overall satisfaction:90%. Will take with him again.
loved his class! funny prof who keeps his lectures interesting. half of lecture is of him showing examples and going over each one in detail so that was very helpful
He was amazing. Such an understanding person. He accommodated to the problems that I was having and the TA was great. Loved the class. Definitely recommend it.

I have taken two courses with Jody - Cmns 220 and 223. He is an awesome professor who is incredibly funny and enjoyable to listen to. His lectures are always fun because the course material is interesting. Exams are a breeze.
He is extremely nice. Not hard, very open to ideas and opinions for the course. But he talks really fast during lecture and hard to take notes down.
